orchestrator.goal: Integrate planner analyses and produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver that encodes the actions, predicates, initial facts from both planners and the combined goals

public_information: Actions available and their informal schemas: paltry requires hand X cats Y texture Z vase X Y and next Y Z; paltry makes next X Z true and makes vase X Y false
sip requires hand X cats Y texture Z next X Z and next Y Z; sip makes vase X Y true and makes next X Z false
clip requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z and next X Z; clip makes vase X Y true and makes next X Z false
wretched requires sneeze X texture Y texture Z stupendous W next X Y collect Y W and collect Z W; wretched makes next X Z true and makes next X Y false
memory requires cats X spring Y spring Z and next X Y; memory makes next X Z true and makes next X Y false
tightfisted requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z and vase X Y; tightfisted makes next X Z true and makes vase X Y false
Predicates observed in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous
Objects are named object_0 through object_11 in observed facts and plans

analyze.system_prompt: You are planner_one. Analyze your private information and provided plan. Extract the concrete objects used, the predicates that must hold before and after each action in the plan, and list any missing preconditions or ambiguous object roles. Produce a compact analysis with an ordered action-step list and the minimal set of factual assertions implied by the plan. Do not emit PDDL here.
analyze.prompt: Your name is planner_one. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->planner_one->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->planner_one->goal}. Provide a stepwise analysis of the plan, identify action schemas referenced, required preconditions per step, expected effects per step, and any gaps or ambiguities that the orchestrator should resolve.

analyze.system_prompt: You are planner_two. Analyze your private information and (if present) any planned actions. Extract the concrete objects used, the predicates that must hold before and after candidate actions, and list any missing preconditions or ambiguous object roles. Produce a compact analysis with an ordered action-step list and the minimal set of factual assertions implied by your information. Do not emit PDDL here.
analyze.prompt: Your name is planner_two. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->planner_two->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->planner_two->goal}. Provide a stepwise analysis of any intended plan, identify action schemas referenced, required preconditions per step, expected effects per step, and any gaps or ambiguities that the orchestrator should resolve.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the analyses you receive into a single coherent PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file that encode the available actions, keep agent actions distinct if necessary, and include the combined initial state and combined goals. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards numeric and ADL restrictions as much as possible. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive analyses from two planners: {workflow->planner_one->analyze->output} and {workflow->planner_two->analyze->output}. Integrate those analyses to produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that represent the actions described in the public information and the concrete facts from both planners. The final PDDL should aim to enable FastDownwards to find plans achieving the combined goals: {agents->planner_one->goal} and {agents->planner_two->goal}. Keep actions distinct and resolve naming or role ambiguities by referring to the analyses. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
